page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: USK AREA - HISTORIC BUILDINGS Usk castle built in the 11th Century was given by Henry VIII to his 6th wife, Queen Catherin Parr. Now in ruins the castle is privately owned, the family living in Castle House, a converted gatehouse. PRIORESS MILL - on the river Usk behind the Agricultural College was a water-mill owned in the Middle Ages by the Abbess of the Cistercian Priory in Usk. It was last used in the 1940's. THE WINDMILL - at Llancayo, reported to have been ruined by fire, has not been used in living memory. It is the subject of a Preservation Order. THE ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH - of St. Francis Xavier was erected in 1847, 50 yds from the scene of the Martyrdom of the St. David Lewis, on the 27th August,1679. He was executed after being found guilty of being a c/priest
